ohi.citation: Halpern BS, Longo C, Hardy D, McLeod KL, Samhouri JF, Katona SK, et al. (2012). An index to assess the health and benefits of the global ocean. Nature. 2012;488: 615–620. doi:10.1038/nature11397. http://www.oceanhealthindex.org/

epi.description: The 2020 Environmental Performance Index (EPI) provides a data-driven summary of the state of sustainability around the world. Using 32 performance indicators across 11 issue categories, the EPI ranks countries on environmental health and ecosystem vitality. These indicators provide a gauge at a national scale of how close countries are to established environmental policy targets.
epi.citation: Wolf, M. J., Emerson, J. W., Esty, D. C., de Sherbinin, A., Wendling, Z. A., et al. (2022). 2022 Environmental Performance Index. New Haven, CT: Yale Center for Environmental Law & Policy. https://epi.yale.edu/

ndgain.description: The Notre Dame-Global Adaptation Index (ND-GAIN) Country Index is a free open- source index that shows a country’s current vulnerability to climate disruptions. It also assesses a country’s readiness to leverage private and public sector investment for adaptive actions. ND-GAIN brings together over 74 variables to form 45 core indicators to measure vulnerability and readiness of UN countries from 1995 to the present. Thirty-six indicators contribute to the vulnerability score and nine indicators contribute to readiness.
ndgain.citation: University of Notre Dame (2019). Notre Dame Global Adaptation Initiative [Data file]. Retrieved from https://gain.nd.edu/our-work/country-index/methodology/

rfti.description: Countries are assessed and ranked with regard to their level of preparedness to adopt to frontier technologies using “Readiness for Frontier Technologies Index”.  UNCTAD’s analytical and technical cooperation work selected 9 indicators within five building blocks  to calculate the “Readiness for Frontier Technologies Index” to measure the capacity to use, adopt and adapt frontier technologies among SIDS and other countries: ICT deployment, skills, R&D activity, industry activity and access to finance.
rfti.citation: UNCTAD (2021). Technology and innovation Report 2021. Catching Technological Wave. (UNCTAD/TIR/2020). Available at https://unctad.org/system/files/official-document/tir2020_en.pdf

ldc.citation: United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs(2022). Least developed Countries [Data file]. Retrieved from https://www.un.org/development/desa/dpad/least-developed-country-category/ldc-data-retrieval.html

egov.citation: United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs(2020). E-Government Survey 2020. Digital Government in the Decade of Action for Sustainable Development. (Report No. ST/ESA/PAD/SER.E/214). United Nations, New York. https://publicadministration.un.org/egovkb/en-us/Reports/UN-E-Government-Survey-2020

gci.citation: International Telecommunication Union. (2021). Global Cybersecurity Index 2020. Measuring Commitment to Cybersecurity. https://www.itu.int/en/ITU-D/Cybersecurity/Pages/GCI/GCIv4-Report-Launch.aspx

ghi.citation: Wiesmann, D., H.-K. Biesalski, K. von Grebmer, and J. Bernstein. 2015. Methodological Review and Revision of the Global Hunger Index. ZEF Working Paper 139. Bonn: Zentrum für Entwicklungsforschung (Center for Development Research). https://www.globalhungerindex.org/about.html

gggr.citation: World Economic Forum (2022). Global Gender Gap Report 2022. https://www.weforum.org/reports/global-gender-gap-report-2022

blasiak.datasetName: Predicted Vulnerability of Fisheries to Climate Change
blasiak.citation: Blasiak R, Spijkers J, Tokunaga K, Pittman J, Yagi N, Österblom H. (2017). Climate change and marine fisheries: Least developed countries top global index of vulnerability. PLoS ONE 12(6): e0179632. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0179632

mvi.citation: Jacob Assa & Riad Meddeb.(2021). Towards a Multidimensional Vulnerability Index. Retrieved from United Nations Development Programme website: https://www.undp.org/publications/towards-multidimensional-vulnerability-index

ssi.citation: Sustainable Society Foundation(2020). Sustainable Society Index.[Data file]. Retrieved from https://ssi.wi.th-koeln.de

wdi.citation: The World Bank. (2021). World Development Indicators. [Data file]. Retrieved from https://datatopics.worldbank.org/world-development-indicators/

irena.description: IRENA’s electricity statistics are available for the year 2000 onwards and cover all countries and areas in the World. In addition to total renewable electricity, more detailed data can also be selected by technology and sub-technology.
irena.citation: International Renewable Energy Agency (2019). IRENA Data and Statistics [Data file]. Retrieved from https://www.irena.org/Statistics/Download-query-tools

ihme.citation: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation. (2019). Global Burden of Disease Study 2019 [Data file]. Retrieved from http://ghdx.healthdata.org/gbd-results-tool

igrac.description: The SIDS viewer provides groundwater related information on Small Island Developing States. At present the system contains mainly information derived from the Transboundary Waters Assessment Program (TWAP) on 43 SIDS. The data include indicators describing the hydrogeological, environmental, socio-economic and governance dimensions of the SIDS groundwater systems.
igrac.citation: international Groundwater Resources Assessment Centre. (2021). SIDS Transboundary Water Assessment Programme. Retrieved on 3rd August 2022 from  https://www.un-igrac.org/ggis/small-island-developing-states-twap
